section.heading: Functions — Disability compensation.
section.text: The functions of the program shall be to:

para.text: Establish appropriate systems and procedures for the reporting of occupational accidents and illnesses;
Maintain and analyze records of all occupational accidents and illnesses occurring within agencies;
Study safety problems and recommend actions to correct undesirable conditions or unsafe practices;
Monitor and evaluate adequacy and effectiveness of safety procedures and practices of District agencies through inspection;
Make determinations and awards for, or against payment of compensation under this chapter;
Pay compensation to employees for work related disability or death resulting from personal injury sustained in the performance of their duty, as specified in this section;
Conduct promotional campaigns to stimulate employees’ interest in accident prevention and to train and motivate supervisors in accident prevention concepts, practices and techniques;
Develop and maintain working agreements with designated physicians and other public or private organizations, as required; and
Monitor the adequacy and effectiveness of medical services under this section, and develop guidelines for the determination of disabilities and professional fees.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 1103(b) of Fiscal Year 2002 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2001 (D.C. Act 14-124, August 3, 2001, 48 DCR 7861).
